p: Biologically, the patient had a normochromic, normocytic anemia with a hemoglobin level of 10, 5 g/dl, a white blood cell count of 8520/mm 3 and a lymphocytopenia level of 700 per mm 3. The C-reactive protein was at 94 mg/l and the erythrocyte sedimentation rate was at 45 mm in the 1 st hour. The search for Koch's bacillus ( Mycobacterium tuberculosis) on direct examination was negative. Serological assays for HBV (viral hepatitis B), HCV (viral hepatitis C), and HIV (human immunodeficiency virus) were negative as well.
